text: Encensé récemment par une critique, ce Resto est victime de son succès.  Bonne cuisine. Petites portions.  Et surtout un service débordé, dépassé par une salle pleine. Il manquait du personnel. Pourtant cela se planifie  avec les réservations. Nous avons pris le menu dégustation. On dépose un plat au centre  de la table et débrouillez vous pour le partage sans les couverts nécessaires qu'ils ne pas changent à chaque service. On se croirais au chinatown... 185$ pour deux avec pourboire

J'ai presque envie de donner un étoile. Le service était froid tout le long: aucune salutation. La serveuse nous a rushé pendant tous nos repas. On n'a même pas fini de manger et le serveur voulait déjà débarrasser les assiettes. 

On était 3, mon amie qui est végétalien a opté pour le choix du chef: la serveuse a dit qu'il va préparer quelque  chose de spécial pour elle: du riz dans une sauce de tomate avec des choux de brucelles, raisins, roquettes et coriandres pour 28$. C'est une vrai joke. La serveuse nous a blâmer parce qu'elle dit qu'il a fallu qu'on appelle avant. (Mais désolé j'avais appeler et le serveur m'a dit qu'il n'y avait pas de problème et que le chef allait s'en occuper.) La serveuse nous a répondu: "ah bon, mais c'était à moi qu'il fallait que tu parle avec." Wow. J'en revenais pas. 

Mon copain et moi, on a pris le bisque à 60$. Une assiette qui était suggérer à partager à 2 et +. What's? 2 minis pétoncles avec genre à peine 10 moules, 2 palourdes?? et 5 crevettes, qui avaient l'air des crevettes congelés... ça ne vaut pas le prix, servis avec des pâtes pappardelle (c'était pas ça du tout?) qui étaient trop épais, et qui ressemblaient à des feuilles d'algues. 

On a aussi pris l'omble d'arctique celui là a fait en sorte que c'est 2 étoiles et non 1.

Bon, je finis là, je ne veux pas écrire un roman. Mais je ne recommande pas cette place à personne. Surtout pour leurs services...

I am decently impressed! and sorry for them at the same time. Let me explain.

I went to Restaurant Prince for a Christmas party. The restaurant was all reserved for us, there was a lot of people and a lot of wine, I mean a whole lot.  The BYOB characteristic is obviously a plus for this place, every one loves a good BYOB. During the whole evening, people were standing, dancing, exchanging wines, it was quite the chaos and even in this ruckus, they delivered brilliantly.

Impeccable food, every one served quickly, pretty much at the same time, all hot and tasty. The waiters were having trouble walking around but they were still very effective and nice. We were a tough lot to please, very difficult but not a single person was disappointed. I've seen not one error, nothing. Everything was perfect. 

What a night!

I will definitely come back on a regular diner.

Being the wine fanatics my boyfriend and I are, we always love to discover a good BYOW restaurant and Prince delivers the goods! 
Recently opened in the locals of the old restaurant les infidèles, the new owners have really turned this place around! 

Decor is bright and welcoming, clean lines, Scandinavian inspired decor and excellent warm lighting to amp up wine and dine kinda night. 

Menu is diverse with items incorporating classic French fair with modern twists. We wanted to try everything off the menu as our lovely waitress was so enthusiastic in her descriptions, which were also as it turned out later, spot on! 

We opted for the beef tartar and the smoked salmon as appetizers. Both were very impressive. The smoked salmon was a thick sashimi like cut, plated beautifully amongst dollops of sweet and salty sauce that complimented it beautifully. It was served with a scotch quail egg in a fresh sour cream based sauce, it was perfectly crispy on the outside, but slightly overlooked inside as the egg did not ooze its gooey yellowish. I guess cooking the meat while leaving the small egg inside oozing is much harder than a regular egg. 
The beef tartar was also quite delicious. It had just the right amount of kick to it the sweet squash purée that lay beneath it gave it quite a welcoming hint of sweetness. 

For mains we opted for the attic char and the faux filet. 
The Arctic char was cooked to perfection! The skin was so crispy while the meat was tender as it bathed in a rich healthful canneberge risotto... yummy! The steak being a strip loin cut was quite tender. However the foie gras reduction that came with it was a bit disappointing. It was too liquid for my tastes and lacking in FG flavour. 

Portions for mains were quite generous, which is a pleasant surprise for newer French fare. We were quite full by the end of all this and didn't indulge in dessert. 

My only negatives about the evening was that the entryway lacked a proper vestibule. And having dined on a cold Montreal right, the draft that would come in every few minutes was distracting. Maybe they could put up a curtain to fend off some of the cold? 
Also the prices are a bit on the higher side for a BYOW 14-18 for appetizers and 30-40 for mains. But the quality of the food definitely made up for the steeper price. 

Overall, we had quite a nice evening in the new comer BYOW and will definitely be back!

Love the "Bring Your Own Wine" concept :)

Good menu, nice staff, and overall a great ambiance.
